page.title: 12STOWEY VILLAGE
page.content: The old face of Stowey is slowly disappearing. The cottages are being modernised, but still retain the character of the village.Twenty-six families live in Stowey of whom half have lived and worked there for more than twenty-five years.Few people commute to Bristol or Bath and many work locally and are connected with the land. Everyone supports the Annual Harvest Suppers and the Barbecues in the Henry Strachey Memorial Hall which raises money for the Church. Apart from Festivals,few local people regularly attend services. Heavy traffic now spoils the peace of the village and plans in hand for the development of Sutton Court and the Estate, now in a state of disrepair, mean many changes in the future.
